title: Daniel Molitor
text:
Daniel Molitor PhD Student @ Cornell Information Science    













Hello there! I’m a second-year PhD student at Cornell’s School of Information Science. My research interests are centered in the Computational Social Sciences and I have a particular interest in causal inference and how computational methods can help us do better causal inference. On the side, I love open source software and enjoy building tools and learning new technologies whenever I can. I’m very thankful to have my work supported by an NSF Graduate Research Fellowship!

You can access my CV here.
